Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Present were AUSA Julia Diaz-Rex and Mr. Guillermo Macari.Arraignment as to Gabriel Lugo-Maldonado (19) Count 1 held on 5/10/2010. Defendant waived reading of indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The case is referred to Judge Dominguez for trial scheduling. Bail Hearing as to Gabriel Lugo-Maldonado held on 5/10/2010. Mr. Macari stated that they had nothing to offer as to bail. The Court adopted the recommendations made by PT and ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter -FTR.)(Court Interpreter -Mary Jo Smith.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 04:03.Hearing ended at 04:07. (yr) (Entered: 05/12/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Present were AUSA Jenifer Hernandez, Mr. Luis Guzman-Dupont and PTO E. Jimenez. Arraignment as to Jose Guillermo Rodriguez-Pabon (18) Count 1,2,3 held on 5/11/2010. Defendant waived reading of indictment and entered a plea of not guilty. Case is referred to Judge Dominguez for trial scheduling. Detention Hearing as to Jose Guillermo Rodriguez-Pabon held on 5/11/2010. Bail is set in the amount of $5,000.00 of which $1,000.00 is to be cash or secured and $4,000.00 unsecured, home incarceration with EM, he's to reside outside Perla del Caribe housing project and he's not to enter or approach the same, plus all other standard conditions of release. (Court Reporter -FTR.) (Court Interpreter -Janis Palma.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:50.Hearing ended at 10:07. (yr) (Entered: 05/12/2010)

Detention Hearing as to Oswald Lopez-Ortiz held on 5/11/2010. Arguments heard as to bail for this defendant. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Present were AUSA Jenifer Hernandez and Mr. Francisco Adams.Arraignment as to Alberto Rodriguez-Soler (13) Count 1,2,3 held on 5/11/2010. After hearing arguments as to bail, the Court set bail in the amount of $5,000.00 of which $1,000.00 are to be cash or secured and $4,000.00 unsecured, home incarceration with EM, mental health treatment, UA and/or treatment, he's to reside outside the housing project and not to approach or enter the same, he's to reside with a family member, not in the same house as his co-defendant brother, plus all other standard conditions of release. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Show Cause Hearing as to Alberto Rodriguez-Soler held on 1/24/2011. Present were AUSA Michael Bagge, Mr. Francisco Adams and PO J. Santana. Arguments heard from defense counsel as to the violations alleged in the motion filed by Probation. AUSA Bagge requested revocation of bail. PO Santana addressed the Court explaining the instructions given to the defendant and the perimeter of the monitoring device in the house defendant is staying. Defense counsel offered an alternative residence farther from the housing project. The Court ruled that in essence defendant was admitting to the violations contained in the motion, that defendant had the most restrictive conditions which could be imposed and he still failed to comply with the same. Therefore, the Court revoked the bail previously imposed and is ordered detained without bail. (Court Reporter -FTR.)(Court Interpreter -Felix Toledo.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:27.Hearing ended at 09:43. (yr) (Entered: 01/24/2011)

ORDER denying (By Order of the Court) 982 Motion to Reduce Sentence re Crack Cocaine Offense - 18:3582 as to Oswald Lopez-Ortiz (2). In view of the unopposed recommendation of the United States Probation Officer in relation to defendant's motion seeking a sentence reduction and retroactive application of the Sentencing Guidelines under 18 U.S.C. Sec. 3582 (c)(2), Docket No. 988, and it appearing that the defendant is clearly not eligible for sentence reduction since he was sentenced based upon a controlled substance other than crack cocaine, that is, cocaine, said recommendation is adopted and the motion for retroactive application of the Sentencing Guidelines is Denied. (By Order of the Court). Signed by U.S. Magistrate Judge Justo Arenas on 10/3/2013. (Arenas, Justo) (Entered: 10/03/2013)

ORDER denying 1091 Motion Requesting Transcript and denying 1091 Motion for Extension of Time to File as to Jariel Martinez-Rivera (20) as both are time-barred. Specifically, petitions for relief under 28 U.S.C. § 2255 have a one (1) year limitation  period that runs from the date on which the judgment of conviction becomes final. See 28 U.S.C. § 2255(f)(1). As Mr. Martinez-Rivera's conviction became final on August Sth, 2011 and he never filed an appeal, the current petition is time-barred by over four (4) years.Signed by Judge Daniel R. Dominguez on 12/21/2015. (JM) Modified on 12/22/2015 This order was not notified due to release of deft on 12/18/15 as per inmate locator of BOP (np). (Entered: 12/21/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Daniel R. Dominguez: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Alberto Rodriguez-Soler (13) held on 8/23/2019. Present: AUSA Myriam Fernandez, AFPD Joannie Plaza and USPO Alexandria Oliveras. Defendant present, under custody and assisted by the official court interpreter. Defense counsel advised that defendant will not contest the allegations on the motion filed by U.S. Probation Office at ECF 1225 . Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of defendant. Government's position as to punishment heard. After having heard the parties, the Court found that defendant violated the conditions of supervised release. Therefore, the supervised release term previously imposed was revoked. The Court imposed sentence. IMPR: Twenty-Four (24) months; SRT:Three (3) years. Defendant was advised his right to appeal. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment form. (Court Reporter Lisa O'Brien.) Hearing set for 10:00. Hearing held at 11:10. Hearing ended at 11:50. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (amr) (Entered: 08/26/2019)
